description: The patient sits in a specially designed tub filled with cold water up to the navel, while keeping the feet outside and the upper body dry.
contraindications: Avoid during active menstruation, acute asthma, and severe lower back pain.

description: Similar to the cold hip bath, but uses comfortably hot water (around 40Â°C) to relieve pelvic spasms and increase local circulation.
contraindications: Avoid in cases of heavy menstrual bleeding, bleeding piles, and acute pelvic inflammation.

description: The patient's feet and calves are immersed in a bucket of hot water. A cold wet towel is often placed on the head to draw congested blood away from the brain.
contraindications: Avoid if suffering from deep vein thrombosis (DVT), severe varicose veins, or peripheral neuropathy with loss of heat sensation.

description: The patient lies in a specially shaped shallow tub so that only the spine and back are immersed in water (can be cold, neutral, or hot).
contraindications: Avoid cold spinal baths during high fever or acute chest infections.

description: Introduction of pure, lukewarm water into the rectum to flush out accumulated fecal matter and toxins from the colon.
contraindications: Strictly avoid in acute appendicitis, severe bleeding piles, intestinal obstruction, and rectal prolapse.

description: A thick cotton cloth is soaked in cold water, wrung out, and placed over a specific body part (like the forehead, abdomen, or throat).
contraindications: Avoid applying to the chest during deep chest colds or severe bronchitis.

description: The patient sits in a closed wooden cabinet with their head exposed outside, while the body is subjected to herbal steam to induce heavy sweating.
contraindications: Avoid in high blood pressure, heart disease, extreme physical weakness, and pregnancy.

description: Clean, purified clay is soaked in water, spread on a cotton cloth, and placed over the abdomen to cool the digestive system and absorb toxins.
contraindications: Avoid during severe stomach cramps, active diarrhea, and extremely cold weather.

description: A fine paste of purified mud (like Multani Mitti) mixed with rose water or neem water applied directly to the face.
contraindications: Avoid applying over open, bleeding, or severely infected wounds.

description: Purified mud is applied all over the body. The patient sits in the sun until it dries, followed by a cold shower to invigorate the skin.
contraindications: Avoid during high fever, extreme cold, or severe respiratory congestion.

description: Exposing the bare skin to the gentle morning or late afternoon sun to absorb Vitamin D and stimulate deep cellular healing.
contraindications: Avoid during peak afternoon hours (11 AM - 3 PM), sunstroke, or if suffering from severe skin burns.

description: Using an infrared lamp to apply dry, penetrating heat to a specific localized area of pain or stiffness.
contraindications: Do not use over acute, hot, swollen inflammatory joints (like a fresh gout flare-up) or open wounds.

description: Total abstinence from solid food. The patient consumes only diluted fresh lemon juice with a spoonful of raw honey and water for 1-3 days.
contraindications: Avoid in advanced diabetes, severe gastric ulcers, extreme emaciation (underweight), and pregnancy.

description: Replacing heavy solid meals with freshly extracted, diluted, unsweetened vegetable and fruit juices (like Ash Gourd, Carrot, or Citrus).
contraindications: Diabetics must avoid high-sugar fruit juices; kidney disease patients must monitor potassium-rich juices.

description: Walking or performing light exercises in fresh, unpolluted morning air while wearing minimal, loose-fitting cotton clothing.
contraindications: None, though one should dress appropriately if the weather is extremely cold.

description: Vigorous upward rubbing of the body using a dry, rough towel, a soft brush, or dry herbal powders to stimulate the lymphatic system.
contraindications: Avoid in eczema, psoriasis, severe varicose veins, and highly sensitive skin.

description: Gentle, rhythmic manipulation of the body's soft tissues using natural oils like sesame, coconut, or mustard oil.
contraindications: Avoid immediately after heavy meals, during acute fever, or over deep vein thrombosis (DVT).

description: The patient is wrapped entirely in a cold, wet cotton sheet, followed tightly by a dry woolen blanket to trap body heat and induce deep sweating.
contraindications: Avoid in severe heart conditions, extreme physical weakness, or asthma.

description: A localized pack around the chest consisting of a wet cotton cloth wrapped over the ribcage, covered by a dry woolen cloth.
contraindications: Do not apply tightly enough to restrict breathing.

description: Immersing the body in a warm bath dissolved with Magnesium Sulfate (Epsom salts) to draw out lactic acid and relax muscles.
contraindications: Avoid in severe open skin conditions or if the patient is severely dehydrated.
